title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Darby sure sells rotten liquor.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Warms you up, though.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Feels like fire creepingin the short grass.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I guess I'll just let herspread a little while.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Put out that light, you fool.You want to give us away?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Who to?- Chuck that butt, or I'll plug you.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Start something, for every holeyou make, I'll make two.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Looks like you're gonna havea lot of shooting to do, Mr. Farnley.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Listen! Something's coming.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Fool, stop! Stop him!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - What's the matter, Art?I'm shot.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Where?- Left shoulder.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You fool. Nobody but a drunken idiotwould drive down a grade in the dark.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I thought it was a stickup.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That coach ought to bein the bottom of the canyon right now.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Rose Mapen!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Hello, everybody.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: This is my husband,Mr. Swanson of San Francisco...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... and my sister-in-law,Miss Swanson.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Did you just get married, Rose?- Just today.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: No wonder you were in such a hurry.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: My name's Tetley. I canunderstand why Rose was in a hurry...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... to show the other ladies whatcould be done in the way of matrimony.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Thank you, sir.- What's everybody doing up here?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Why, uh...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Art's shot.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What? Bring him over here.Give him a hand there.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You hadn't ought to comebarging out like that in the dark!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - I couldn't tell who it was, all the yelling...- Aw, shut up.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Here, I'm good at this sort of thing.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Look, do women have to watch this?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: There's room in the stagecoachfor you, Art.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Yeah, I better get you back, get you food.I'm all right.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Be a good boy. Don't be stubborn.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Yeah, don't be a fool.- Mind your own business!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - She's his wife now. And kind of new.- Yeah, looks that way, don't it?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I take it you had the privilege of knowingMiss Mapen before she married me?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That's right.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Possibly you imagined at the time therewas some understanding between you?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Yeah, sure.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - My wife is a very impulsive woman.- That's what I'm saying.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'm pleased to regard any friendof my wife's as a friend of my own.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: However, I don't need to remind youthe pleasure of such an acquaintance...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... depends upon the recognition by allparties that Miss Mapen is now my wife.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: She must be given time to becomeaccustomed to her new responsibilities.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: As yet, I must confess thatI'm jealous of her least attention.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You'll forgive me, I know.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: A bridegroom is prone to beoverly susceptible for a time.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Later, when we've had time to getaccustomed to our new relations...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... I shall be delighted to welcome you...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... and others of my wife's friendsto our home in San Francisco.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If it is still her desire.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Until then.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Why, that superior little...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Looks like Rose has tookunto herself a lot of trouble.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Where are we?- The Ox-Bow.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: There they are, gentlemen.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I suggest we avoid any shooting orrough work until they tell it their way.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Mr. Mapes and I will do the talking.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - The one that got Kinkaid is mine.- He's yours when we're sure.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Ten men will go with Mrs. Grierfrom behind.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Bartlett, take six menand work through those woods.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Gerald, you and Farnleyand the rest will go with me.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Would you like a gun, Mr. Davies?- No, thank you.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Sparks?- Thank you, no, sir, Major Tetley.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: As you choose.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Get up!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Drop it!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Now put up your hands.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That's all right, brother. You will.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Take it easy. Stay where you areand put your hands up.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Gerald, collect their guns.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What do you want?Shut up.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: This ain't no stickup. This is a posse,if that means anything to you.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: But we haven't done anything.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Gerald!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Get 'em up!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Tie them up.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: All right, get in there.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Tell us what we're being held for.- I'd rather you told us.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: We must be pretty important,or else awfully dangerous.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: It ain't that you're so dangerous.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: It's just that most of themain't never seen a triple hanging.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: A hanging? What have we done?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Aren't you even going to tell us?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Rustling. Ever hear of it?- Rustling?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: And murder.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Murder?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Mr. Martin, what did we do?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: It's all right, Dad.There's some mistake.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Remember me?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He's talking to you, mister.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - He don't speak English.- I got a different notion.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'll make him talk.That'll do, Farnley.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I've had enough of yourplaying God almighty!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Who picked you for this jobanyhow?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: We got them.Let's swing them before we all freeze.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If you're cold, here's the fire.Warm yourself.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I advise you to control your tongue too.We'll get along better.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Who's boss of this outfit?- I am.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - And your name?- Donald Martin.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Where you from?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Pike's Hole.That's a lie.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He's from Pike's Hole.Want to change your story?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I just moved in. I'm onDave Baker's place, up in the north end.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Dave moved out four years ago.The place is a wreck.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: The barns are all down, and thesagebrush is up through the porch.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Well, I bought the place from himfor $4000 in Los Angeles last month.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Then, mister, you was robbed.- That may be.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Surely it's not so far to Pike's Holethat you can't go find out.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: My wife's there right now,and my two kids.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That's really too bad.Just too bad.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Even in this godforsaken countryI've got a right to a trial.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You're getting a trial with the only kindof judges murderers and rustlers get...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... in what you callthis "godforsaken country. "
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: So far,the jury don't like your story.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I won't say another wordwithout a hearing.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: This is all the hearing you'll get,short of the Last Judgment.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Have you any cattle up here with you?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Hey, Mr. Martin.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'm not gonna ask you again.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Yes, I have.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - How many?- Fifty head.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Where'd you get them?- From Mr. Kinkaid.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That's just what we figured.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'm no rustler. I didn't steal them.I paid hard cash for them.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Mine were so bad, I didn't bring them.I sold them off.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I had to stock up again.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Can't you wait till you see Kinkaidor ask about me in Pike's Hole?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That's a good one.He wants us to ask Kinkaid.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Gotta hand it to you,you're a cool one.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You know as well as we doKinkaid can't tell us anything.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - He's dead.- Dead?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What do you think we're here for?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: How should I know'?He was all right yesterday.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Why don't you juststop this farce and take us in?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Because the law's slowand careless around here.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: We're here to see it's speeded up.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Who sent you up here?- The sheriff.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That ain't true.Let's don't get started again.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - The sheriff didn't know we were coming.- I should have said deputy sheriff.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'm not trying to obstruct justice, but justas this young man says, this is a farce...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... and it'll be murderif you carry it through.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: All he's asking is whatevery man's entitled to: a fair trial.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You say you're innocent,and I believe you.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Then you're the only one.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If there's any justice here...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... it would only be after a confession.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: They say they're innocent,and you haven't proved they're not!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Shut up!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Have you a bill of sale for those cattle?- No, but Kinkaid said it'd be all right.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He was on the range and didn'thave one with him. He said he'd mail it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Moore.- Yep?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - How long you been riding for Kinkaid?- Six years.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Ever know him to sell any cattlewithout a bill of sale?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: No, can't say that I ever did.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Of course, I can't rememberevery head he sold.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - But it's customary for him to give one?- Yep.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Ever know him to sell cattleafter spring roundup?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - This year or any other year?I can answer that.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I heard him say a couple days ago hewouldn't sell a head to nobody this spring.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Well?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I know it looks bad, a dead manas a witness, but it's the truth.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - You don't believe me?- Would you, in my place?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'd find out before hangingthree men who might be innocent.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If it were only rustling, maybe.But with murder, no.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What are you trying to do?Play cat and mouse?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I would prefer a confession, Martin.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If you've got doubts, let's call offthis party, take them to the judge.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: This is only slightly any of your business.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Hanging's any man's businessthat's around.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If your stomach for justice is cooling,I advise you leave before we proceed.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Your interruptions will become tiresome.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I don't like it!Hanging murderers is one thing...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... but to keep possibly innocent mensweating while you mouth off is another.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Take it easy.This ain't our picnic.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If you keep on butting in, it might be.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You called this old man "Dad. "
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Is he your father?- No.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Speak up,you're taking it like a woman.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Keep your chin up.You can only die once.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: No, he works for me.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I didn't do it.I ain't even got a gun
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Then who did?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: The Mexican did it. He told me so.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: No... I saw him do it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Juan couldn't have done it.I was with him.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Yes, he did, Mr. Martin.He was asleep...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... and he didn't mean to tell me...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... but I was awake, andI heard him talking about it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He doesn't knowwhat he's talking about.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He invents things.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If you've got to go through withthis comedy, let him alone.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ' Shut up!Lay Off, Mapes!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: First he won't talk.Now he talks too much.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What's his name?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Alva Hardwick.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - And the other?- Juan Martinez.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: No, it ain't.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Still don't remember me, eh?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'm talking to you, mister.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: The devil you don't.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Your name's Francisco Morez.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: The vigilantes wouldlike to get hold of you.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: They want him for murder.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: How about that?- I don't know.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Stick together nice, don't they?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Why question me when youdon't believe anything I say?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: There's truth in lies too,if you can get enough of them.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What do you know about the old man?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - He was in the Army.- Confederate or Union?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He's not clear about it himself.Maybe both, at different times.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: A half-wit in the Army?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Attention!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He's forgotten.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Not that.I'll make a deal with you, Martin.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Tell us which of you shot Kinkaidand the other two can wait.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: None of us killed anybody.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Then that's all, I guess.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Bring them along.You're not going to do it really!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You've got to wait, I tell you!You've gotta give us some time!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You've got to give us some time!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - We haven't done anything.Throw the other rope up there.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Remember, the Mexican's mine.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: My kids! One of them is a baby!They haven't got a thing to go on!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I've got to write a letter.If you're human, you'll give me time.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - That ain't asking much.- They're trying to put it off.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Want Tyler and the sheriff to get here?- They won't come in time.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I believe you're right, Mr. Davies,though I doubt if you want to be.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What time is it'?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Five minutes after 3.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: All right.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: We don't want to give anyonecause for complaint.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: With your permission,we'll wait till daylight.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Bring them back.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That'll give you time, Reverend,to finish your business at leisure.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Sure. And them time to think it over.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - I can't write like this.- Very well, untie them.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He says he wants to eat.He's much hungry from so much talk.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Thank you.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Why, look! Fresh beef!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Oh, Ma, fix up a spread for everybody.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Can't call it stealing. By the timeit's ate, there won't be any owners.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What are you thinking about?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Sheriff. He's an awful long timegetting anywhere.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Suppose he don't get here at all?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That's what I'm thinking.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'm not disputing that fact.It may be a fine letter.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: But if it's an honest letter,it's none of my business to read it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If it isn't, I don't want to.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Is that my letter you're showing?- Yes.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - What right have you to show it?Don't raise your voice!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I told him I'd keep it for him.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - All I asked was to make sure it's delivered.- I'm sorry. I was trying-
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: It's enough to be hanged without havingyour private thoughts handed around.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - I said I'm sorry. I was merely-- I don't care what you were doing!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I didn't write that letter to be passedaround. It's not their business!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I made no promise, son.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I thought there was one white man here.I was wrong. Give me my letter.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'll see that she gets it.- I wouldn't have her touch it now.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: In that case, give him back the letter.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Your wife ought to hear from you, son.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: None of us could be as kindand understanding as this letter.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: She'll want to keep itfor your children.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'm sorry.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: The Mex!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Spread out!He may have a gun!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Keep an eye on these two!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Where's he hit?In the leg.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Here's his gun.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Well, I guess we know now, don't we?Look!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Say, that's Larry Kinkaid's gun.Where'd you get this?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Take this bullet out, I'll tell you.- So he speaks American.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: And 10 other languages, my dear.But I don't tell anything I don't want to.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: My leg, please. I wish to stand uprightwhen you come to your pleasure.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Lend me a knife.- Don't give him no knife.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He can throw a knife betterthan most men shoot.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Better than any of you, no doubt.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: But if you're afraid, I promiseto give the knife back, handle first.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'll do it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He is very polite, but hasno stomach for blood, eh'?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That was very fine shooting, my friend.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You should try again with that one.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Where'd you get that gun?- Found it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Where?- Lying in the road.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - You're a liar.- Thought we'd find somebody...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... to send it back by.- You're a liar.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - And you're a blind fool.- I asked you where you got it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - But that's the truth. He did find it.- Undoubtedly.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Won't you even read it?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Because you've made up your minds,or because everybody else has...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... and you're afraid to stand upfor what is right?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You heard what Martin said.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What does it matter who seesthis letter if it saves him from hanging?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: It's a beautiful letter.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Read it, and you'll know he's notthe kind of man who could steal or kill.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Maybe...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... but that can't stand up against cattle,no bill of sale, and a dead man's gun.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I suggest we act as a unit so therecan be question of mistaken reprisals.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Mr. Davies, are you willing to abideby a majority decision?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - How about the rest of you?Sure. Majority rules.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Everybody who's with Mr. Davies in turningit over to the courts, step over there.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Excuse me.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Seven.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Not a majority, I believe, Mr. Davies.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Any other messageyou'd like to leave, Martin?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - I don't wanna die.- I'd like to make a confession.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: And about time.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - To a priest.There's no priest here.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: This man can hear meand take it to a priest.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: All right. Get along with it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Bring them along.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That must have beenan awfully busy life.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Farnley, you, Gabe Hart and Geraldwill whip the horses out.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: No, not me.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Any volunteers?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'll do it if no one else will.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - I won't do it.- You'll do it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - I can't.- We'll see to it that you can.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: The kid's seen enough already.Let him alone.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: This is not your affair, Carter.Thank you just the same.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'll have no female boysbearing my name.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You'll do your partand say nothing more.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What did he say?- I ain't no priest.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: For God's sake, at leastsay whether we'd better wait.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I ain't no priest. I don't know.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: No, thanks.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'll give you two minutes to pray.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Time's up.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Will you find someone to look out formy family? Better take some older woman.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Don't worry.- Miriam's parents live in Ohio.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Maybe Kinkaid's wife'll buy the cattleback for enough to cover their travel.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Tie them up.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: It's no good telling youagain that we're innocent?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - No good.It's not for myself I'm asking.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Other men with families havehad to die. It's justice.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: What do you care about justice?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You don't even care whetheryou've got the right men.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: All you know issomebody's got to be punished.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: There's nobody to look out for them.Can't you understand that?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: This is a fine companyfor a man to die with.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Shut up, you! Shut up!- You shut up!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Careful! Careful!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Tear him loose, don't let him do that.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Stop it, you fools!- No, you stop it!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Keep him there!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: All right. Put them up.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Miriam...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I don't want to die.I don't want to die.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Anytime you're ready, Mr. Mapes.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Finish him.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Hey, there!What's all that shooting about?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: We got them, sheriff!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Everything's been attended to.- What do you mean'?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - Kinkaid's murderers. We got all of them.- Hung them too, sheriff.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Larry Kinkaid's not dead.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Not dead?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: But we just.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I just left Kinkaid with a doctor.Caught the fellows who shot him too.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: But, sheriff, they had Larry's cattle.They even had his gun.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Give me that badge.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I know you well enough to knowyou didn't have anything to do with this.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'm depending on youto tell me who did.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: All but seven.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: God better have mercy on you.You won't get any from me.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: All right, let's go.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If you've got no objections,I'd like to read Martin's letter.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: It'd be a good ideaif a lot of people read it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: If you ask me, that Tetley'sthe one we ought to lynch.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You're a great one for hanging,ain't you, Smith?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You loved it,that's why you kept them waiting.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I saw your face. It was the faceof a depraved, murderous beast.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Only two things ever meantanything to you: power and cruelty.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You can't feel pity.You can't even feel guilt.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You knew they were innocent, butyou were crazy to see them hanged...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... and to make me watch it.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I could've stopped you with a gun, justas any other animal can be stopped...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... but I couldn't do itbecause I'm a coward.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Aren't you glad you made me go?Weren't you proud of me'?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: How does it feel to havebegot a weakling, major?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Does it make you afraid there maybe some weakness in you too...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... that other men might discoverand whisper about?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Open the door! I want to see your face.I want to know how you feel now!
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: They're getting up a potfor Martin's wife.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Even Mapes chipped in.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - I didn't know he was showing his face.- He ain't. He sent it by Sparks.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: That reminds me,I put in 25 bucks apiece for us.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: - How much they got?- About 500.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Not bad for a husband who boughtcattle in the spring without a bill of sale.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Maybe you ought to readthis letter too.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: You know I can't read.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I'll read it to you.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: "My dear wife:
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Mr. Davies will tell youwhat's happening here.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He's a good man andhas done everything he can for me.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: There are some other good men too,only they don't realize what they're doing.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: They're the ones I feel sorry for,because it'll be over for me...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... but they'll have to go on rememberingfor the rest of their lives.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: A man just can't take the law into hisown hands and hang people...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... without hurtingeverybody in the world...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... because then he's not justbreaking one law, but all laws.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Law is a lot more than wordsyou put in a book...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... or judges or lawyers or sheriffsyou hire to carry it out.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: It's everything people ever havefound out about justice...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... and what's right and wrong.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: It's the very conscience of humanity.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: There can't be anysuch thing as civilization...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... unless people have a conscience...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... because if peopletouch God anywhere...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... where is it exceptthrough their conscience?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: And what is anybody's conscience...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... except a little piece of the conscienceof all men that ever lived?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: I guess that's allI've got to say, except...
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: ... kiss the babies for me,and God bless you.
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Your husband, Donald. "
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Where are we going?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: He said he wanted his wifeto get this letter, didn't he?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident

text: Said there was nobodyto look after the kids, didn't he?
title: The Ox-Bow Incident
